description: Creates an application that has one configuration template named default and no application versions.

parameters.name: ApplicationName
parameters.description: The name of the application. Must be unique within your account.

parameters.name: ResourceLifecycleConfig
parameters.description: Specifies an application resource lifecycle configuration to prevent your application from accumulating too many versions. ServiceRole (string) --- The ARN of an IAM service role that Elastic Beanstalk has permission to assume. The ServiceRole property is required the first time that you provide a VersionLifecycleConfig for the application in one of the supporting calls ( CreateApplication or UpdateApplicationResourceLifecycle). After you provide it once, in either one of the calls, Elastic Beanstalk persists the Service Role with the application, and you don't need to specify it again in subsequent UpdateApplicationResourceLifecycle calls. You can, however, specify it in subsequent calls to change the Service Role to another value. VersionLifecycleConfig (dict) --- Defines lifecycle settings for application versions. MaxCountRule (dict) --- Specify a max count rule to restrict the number of application versions that are retained for an application. Specify true to apply the rule, or false to disable it. MaxCount (integer) --- Specify the maximum number of application versions to retain. DeleteSourceFromS3 (boolean) --- Set to true to delete a version's source bundle from Amazon S3 when Elastic Beanstalk deletes the application version. MaxAgeRule (dict) --- Specify a max age rule to restrict the length of time that application versions are retained for an application. MaxAgeInDays (integer) --- Specify the number of days to retain an application versions. DeleteSourceFromS3 (boolean) --- Set to true to delete a version's source bundle from Amazon S3 when Elastic Beanstalk deletes the application version.

nested_params.name: ServiceRole
nested_params.description: The ARN of an IAM service role that Elastic Beanstalk has permission to assume. The ServiceRole property is required the first time that you provide a VersionLifecycleConfig for the application in one of the supporting calls ( CreateApplication or UpdateApplicationResourceLifecycle). After you provide it once, in either one of the calls, Elastic Beanstalk persists the Service Role with the application, and you don't need to specify it again in subsequent UpdateApplicationResourceLifecycle calls. You can, however, specify it in subsequent calls to change the Service Role to another value.

nested_params.name: VersionLifecycleConfig
nested_params.description: Defines lifecycle settings for application versions.

nested_params.name: MaxCountRule
nested_params.description: Specify a max count rule to restrict the number of application versions that are retained for an application.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: Specify true to apply the rule, or false to disable it.

nested_params.name: MaxCount
nested_params.description: Specify the maximum number of application versions to retain.

nested_params.name: DeleteSourceFromS3
nested_params.description: Set to true to delete a version's source bundle from Amazon S3 when Elastic Beanstalk deletes the application version.

nested_params.name: MaxAgeRule
nested_params.description: Specify a max age rule to restrict the length of time that application versions are retained for an application.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: Specify true to apply the rule, or false to disable it.

nested_params.name: MaxAgeInDays
nested_params.description: Specify the number of days to retain an application versions.

nested_params.name: DeleteSourceFromS3
nested_params.description: Set to true to delete a version's source bundle from Amazon S3 when Elastic Beanstalk deletes the application version.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: Specifies the tags applied to the application. Elastic Beanstalk applies these tags only to the application. Environments that you create in the application don't inherit the tags. (dict) --- Describes a tag applied to a resource in an environment. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Value (string) --- The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: Application
nested_items.description: The  ApplicationDescription of the application.

nested_items.name: ApplicationArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the application.

nested_items.name: ApplicationName
nested_items.description: The name of the application.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: User-defined description of the application.

nested_items.name: DateCreated
nested_items.description: The date when the application was created.

nested_items.name: DateUpdated
nested_items.description: The date when the application was last modified.

nested_items.name: Versions
nested_items.description: The names of the versions for this application.
(string) ---

nested_items.description: The names of the configuration templates associated with this application.
